Figaro.State","name":"state","type":"uint8"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"coordinationCapitalBalance","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"errors":{"AddressEmptyCode(address)":[{"details":"There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract)."}],"AddressInsufficientBalance(address)":[{"details":"The ETH balance of the account is not enough to perform the operation."}],"ECDSAInvalidSignature()":[{"details":"The signature derives the `address(0)`."}],"ECDSAInvalidSignatureLength(uint256)":[{"details":"The signature has an invalid length."}],"ECDSAInvalidSignatureS(bytes32)":[{"details":"The signature has an S value that is in the upper half order."}],"FailedInnerCall()":[{"details":"A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted."}],"ReentrancyGuardReentrantCall()":[{"details":"Unauthorized reentrant call."}],"SafeERC20FailedOperation(address)":[{"details":"An operation with an ERC20 token failed."}]},"events":{"SrpCreated(uint256,uint256,bytes32,uint256,bytes32,address,address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Canonical creation event. Off-chain consumers should reconstruct the creation hash (`srpHash`) using the exact field order below so they can validate SRP chain integrity. The contract computes the creation hash as:   creationHash = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(prevHash, seller, buyer, amount, token, totalProcessValue)) Responsibilities: - `SrpCreated`: immutable creation linkage emitted only at creation   (create / add / addSrpSigned / sellerBatchAdd flows). - `SrpStateChanged`: lifecycle updates, deltas, and balance snapshots."},"SrpStateChanged(uint256,uint256,address,address,address,bytes32,bytes32,uint8,uint8,int256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Versioning and dedupe guidance: - `versionHash` is computed at each state transition and mirrors contract   usage: versionHash = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(creationHash, uint256(newState), coordinationCapitalBalance)) - Indexers should use (srpId, versionHash) as a primary dedupe key to   detect duplicate emissions produced by dual-emission compatibility. - For strict ordering or when dual-emits must be disambiguated, use   (srpId, blockNumber, logIndex) in combination with the versionHash. `principal` is the indexed party most relevant for off-chain queries (either the seller or the buyer depending on the flow)."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"addSrpSigned((uint256,address,uint256,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,bytes),bytes,bytes)":{"details":"Uses split helpers to avoid large stack frames. Supports optional ERC-2612-style `permit` calldata via `erc2612Permit`. NOTE: Static analysis (Slither `reentrancy-no-eth`) flags an external token call prior to a state write. This is an intentional design: - The function follows CEI ordering where effects are applied before   external token interactions when possible and uses a 1-unit token   probe elsewhere to detect fee-on-transfer tokens. - A runtime `nonReentrant` guard (OpenZeppelin ReentrancyGuard) protects   this function against nested reentrancy. Tests assert this behavior:   `test/ReentrancyRecorder.t.sol` and `test/ReentrancyPermit.t.sol` both   exercise a token-callback reentrancy attempt and observe the   `ReentrancyGuardReentrantCall()` revert."},"addSrpSignedBatch((uint256,address,uint256,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,bytes)[],bytes[],bytes[])":{"details":"Batch variant of `addSrpSigned`. Verifies each payload signature, consumes nonces, creates SRPs and collects coordination capital per SRP. Performs upfront capacity checks per-process to ensure atomicity."},"addSrpToProcess(uint256,address,uint256)":{"details":"Root seller adds a value-added SRP to a process whose root SRP is locked. Requirements: - Caller must be the root seller for `processId`. - The root SRP must already be `Locked`. - Third party seller must not be the process buyer or the root seller. - Third party seller must have approved the root seller. On success this function creates a new SRP, collects the third party seller's coordination capital and protocol fee, and emits `SrpAdded`."},"archiveProcessSrpsWithDeposit(uint256)":{"details":"Permissionless: requires each SRP.archivableAt != 0 and <= block.timestamp"},"batchArchiveProcesses(uint256[])":{"details":"Permissionless batch variant of `archiveProcessSrpsWithDeposit`. Requires all processes to be archivable (archivable timestamp elapsed) and all SRPs terminal. Tokens must match across processes to allow aggregated payout in a single transfer."},"batchCancel(uint256[])":{"details":"Sellers call this to cancel many SRPs in `Created` state. Uses a two-pass approach: validate and aggregate per-token totals, apply CEI state changes, perform aggregated token transfers, and emit per-SRP `SrpStateChanged` events."},"batchCreateProcesses(address[],uint256[],address[])":{"details":"Seller (`msg.sender`) creates multiple processes and pays coordination capital + fee per SRP. Uses CEI ordering: create storage entries first, then collect funds per-SRP."},"batchGrantRootSellerConsent(address[],bool)":{"details":"Third-party sellers call this to approve or revoke many root sellers in a single transaction. Mirrors `grantRootSellerConsent` behavior."},"batchLock(uint256[])":{"details":"Buyer action. For each provided `processId` the root SRP MUST already be `Locked`. The call will collect and lock every SRP in `State.Created` within each process except the root SRP (index 0). All checks are performed first and the pull of the aggregated coordination capital + fee is done once for gas efficiency. Accepts an array of `processIds` and will lock all qualifying SRPs in those processes."},"batchLockRoots(uint256[])":{"details":"Buyer of each root SRP calls this with `processIds`. Allows mixed tokens by aggregating per-token totals then performing per-token pulls."},"batchRefund(uint256[])":{"details":"Sellers call this to withdraw coordination capital for many SRPs. Performs a two-pass approach: validate and aggregate per-token totals, apply CEI state changes, then perform aggregated token transfers, and finally emit per-SRP `SrpStateChanged` events."},"batchRelease(uint256[],uint256)":{"details":"Buyer (root buyer of each process) calls this to release all SRPs in each process. Aggregates buyer refunds and collection of cleanup deposits into a single interaction for gas efficiency while preserving per-process archival bookkeeping."},"cancel(uint256)":{"details":"Only callable by the SRP seller when SRP is in Created state."},"grantRootSellerConsent(address,bool)":{"details":"Third party sellers explicitly approve the rootSeller before the rootSeller may add SRPs that debit the third party seller's tokens.","params":{"approved":"True to approve, false to revoke","rootSeller":"The rootSeller address to approve or revoke"}},"refund(uint256)":{"details":"Only callable by the SRP seller when SRP is in Released state."},"releaseProcessWithCleanupDeposit(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Buyer pays `perSrpDeposit * srpCount` to this contract; each SRP is tagged with an archivable timestamp. This is a minimal port of the UnifiedSRP flow for cleanup deposits."},"sellerBatchAdd(uint256,address[],uint256[])":{"details":"Root seller calls to add multiple SRPs in one atomic transaction."}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"AddSrpConsent(address,address,bool)":{"notice":"Emitted when a third party seller approves or revokes consent for a root seller"},"CleanupDepositPlaced(uint256,address,uint256,uint256,address)":{"notice":"Emitted when a buyer places a per-SRP cleanup deposit at release"},"ProcessArchived(uint256,address,address,uint256[],uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when a process is archived and caller is paid from cleanup deposit"},"SrpArchived(uint256,uint256,address,address,uint256,address,uint256,uint8,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when an SRP is archived and storage deleted"},"SrpCreated(uint256,uint256,bytes32,uint256,bytes32,address,address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when an SRP is created (cryptographically linked into a process chain)"},"SrpStateChanged(uint256,uint256,address,address,address,bytes32,bytes32,uint8,uint8,int256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when an SRP's state changes; includes a version hash for off-chain auditing"}},"kind":"user","methods":{"addSrpSigned((uint256,address,uint256,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,bytes),bytes,bytes)":{"notice":"Add a single SRP authorized by an off-chain seller signature"},"addSrpSignedBatch((uint256,address,uint256,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,bytes)[],bytes[],bytes[])":{"notice":"Add multiple signed SRPs in a single atomic transaction"},"addSrpToProcess(uint256,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Add a new SRP to an existing process (root-seller only)"},"archiveProcessSrpsWithDeposit(uint256)":{"notice":"Archive completed process SRPs that have buyer-funded deposits and pay caller"},"batchArchiveProcesses(uint256[])":{"notice":"Archive multiple processes' SRPs and pay caller from cleanup deposits"},"batchCancel(uint256[])":{"notice":"Cancel multiple SRPs in a single transaction and return coordination capital to sellers"},"batchCreateProcesses(address[],uint256[],address[])":{"notice":"Create multiple processes each with a root SRP in a single transaction"},"batchGrantRootSellerConsent(address[],bool)":{"notice":"Batch grant or revoke consent for multiple root sellers"},"batchLock(uint256[])":{"notice":"Lock all CREATED (non-root) SRPs across multiple processes in a single transaction"},"batchLockRoots(uint256[])":{"notice":"Lock root SRPs for multiple processes in a single transaction"},"batchRefund(uint256[])":{"notice":"Refund multiple SRPs to their seller in a single transaction"},"batchRelease(uint256[],uint256)":{"notice":"Release multiple processes in a single transaction and place per-SRP cleanup deposits"},"cancel(uint256)":{"notice":"Cancel SRP - seller withdraws deposit before buyer locks (abort trade)"},"createProcess(address,uint256,address)":{"notice":"Create a new process with a root SRP and collect seller coordination capital + fee"},"grantRootSellerConsent(address,bool)":{"notice":"Third party seller approves or revokes an rootSeller to add SRPs on their behalf."},"lock(uint256)":{"notice":"Lock the root SRP: buyer deposits coordination capital + fee"},"refund(uint256)":{"notice":"Refund SRP - seller withdraws coordination capital + payment after buyer release"},"releaseProcessWithCleanupDeposit(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Release a process and place buyer-funded per-SRP cleanup deposits"},"sellerBatchAdd(uint256,address[],uint256[])":{"notice":"Seller-side batch SRP addition: create SRPs and collect coordination capital"}},"version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"src/Figaro.sol":"Figaro"},"evmVersion":"cancun","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[":@openzeppelin/contracts/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/",":ds-test/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/lib/forge-std/lib/ds-test/src/",":erc4626-tests/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/lib/erc4626-tests/",":forge-std/=lib/forge-std/src/",":openzeppelin-contracts/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/"],"viaIR":true},"sources":{"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0xc6a8ff0ea489379b61faa647490411b80102578440ab9d84e9a957cc12164e70","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://0ea104e577e63faea3b69c415637e99e755dcbf64c5833d7140c35a714d6d90c","dweb:/ipfs/Qmau6x4Ns9XdyynRCNNp3RhLqijJjFm7z5fyZazfYFGYdq"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/token/ERC20/extensions/IERC20Permit.sol":{"keccak256":"0x6008dabfe393240d73d7dd7688033f72740d570aa422254d29a7dce8568f3aff","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://f5196ec75139918c6c7bb4251b36395e668f1fa6d206beba7e7520e74913940d","dweb:/ipfs/QmSyqjksXxmm2mCG6qRd1yuwLykypkSVBbnBnGqJRcuJMi"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0x37bb49513c49c87c4642a891b13b63571bc87013dde806617aa1efb54605f386","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://b3036b3a83b7c48f96641f2a9002b9f2dcb6a5958dd670894ada21ae8229b3d0","dweb:/ipfs/QmUNfSBdoVtjhETaUJCYcaC7pTMgbhht926tJ2uXJbiVd3"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/Address.sol":{"keccak256":"0xaf28a975a78550e45f65e559a3ad6a5ad43b9b8a37366999abd1b7084eb70721","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://b7bd24e224f67f65bfadf85dc2929fa965456bb2415478bd0125471b5ce35245","dweb:/ipfs/QmRaydGr8BTHs1kvaZfsNU69pKzUAGFrvABn1KiRSbE51y"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/ReentrancyGuard.sol":{"keccak256":"0xf980daa263b661ab8ddee7d4fd833c7da7e7995e2c359ff1f17e67e4112f2236","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://7448ab095d6940130bcf76ba47a2eab14148c83119523b93dd89f6d84edd6c02","dweb:/ipfs/QmawrZ4voKQjH3oomXT3Kuheb3Mnmo2VvVpxg8Ne5UJUrd"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/cryptography/ECDSA.sol":{"keccak256":"0xeed0a08b0b091f528356cbc7245891a4c748682d4f6a18055e8e6ca77d12a6cf","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://ba80ba06c8e6be852847e4c5f4492cef801feb6558ae09ed705ff2e04ea8b13c","dweb:/ipfs/QmXRJDv3xHLVQCVXg1ZvR35QS9sij5y9NDWYzMfUfAdTHF"]},"src/Figaro.sol":{"keccak256":"0xc68d539c67cab855b265b2498bb7f63d0157dd88603b6317097a163ec88ef1a1","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://d256e8536730fbdfd67e694ed7639df051c7c95252de1f8ace8b2a8c0388b939","dweb:/ipfs/QmTQfTf5WPuEJ9onWBtRjnbcsJJwtsRUDg9svcPo94TAYQ"]},"src/IMechanism.sol":{"keccak256":"0x0cc54b27e3871598ae2d72e038287508754e5b7e20e88495dcbc8bf13afd31cc","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://99da7974c490f9bab50759e6024e795902f1189ad92934d7704ceb5bd4d6fed5","dweb:/ipfs/Qmf3qr1kGcFD5MzmMZ8DsSgsmMB3Zexj8EgcK1KdKKGA41"]},"src/SRPFees.sol":{"keccak256":"0xc78e50c2ebdd14ae6c6291998b26856225dc564875b8c5087d98291f16374716","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://1c67a5772c872a3f6c33d5ee232ff37cfb24261d6c61a49f1d51f06ab13e5a60","dweb:/ipfs/QmT1qqFVSbbhGM2JjqcuZ9XHLLs3WJ4DJ9W9yqqLDLfAGA"]}},"version":1}

addSrpSigned((uint256,address,uint256,ad.details: Uses split helpers to avoid large stack frames. Supports optional ERC-2612-style `permit` calldata via `erc2612Permit`. NOTE: Static analysis (Slither `reentrancy-no-eth`) flags an external token call prior to a state write. This is an intentional design: - The function follows CEI ordering where effects are applied before   external token interactions when possible and uses a 1-unit token   probe elsewhere to detect fee-on-transfer tokens. - A runtime `nonReentrant` guard (OpenZeppelin ReentrancyGuard) protects   this function against nested reentrancy. Tests assert this behavior:   `test/ReentrancyRecorder.t.sol` and `test/ReentrancyPermit.t.sol` both   exercise a token-callback reentrancy attempt and observe the   `ReentrancyGuardReentrantCall()` revert.

addSrpSignedBatch((uint256,address,uint2.details: Batch variant of `addSrpSigned`. Verifies each payload signature, consumes nonces, creates SRPs and collects coordination capital per SRP. Performs upfront capacity checks per-process to ensure atomicity.

addSrpToProcess(uint256,address,uint256).details: Root seller adds a value-added SRP to a process whose root SRP is locked. Requirements: - Caller must be the root seller for `processId`. - The root SRP must already be `Locked`. - Third party seller must not be the process buyer or the root seller. - Third party seller must have approved the root seller. On success this function creates a new SRP, collects the third party seller's coordination capital and protocol fee, and emits `SrpAdded`.

archiveProcessSrpsWithDeposit(uint256).details: Permissionless: requires each SRP.archivableAt != 0 and <= block.timestamp

batchArchiveProcesses(uint256[]).details: Permissionless batch variant of `archiveProcessSrpsWithDeposit`. Requires all processes to be archivable (archivable timestamp elapsed) and all SRPs terminal. Tokens must match across processes to allow aggregated payout in a single transfer.

batchCancel(uint256[]).details: Sellers call this to cancel many SRPs in `Created` state. Uses a two-pass approach: validate and aggregate per-token totals, apply CEI state changes, perform aggregated token transfers, and emit per-SRP `SrpStateChanged` events.

batchCreateProcesses(address[],uint256[].details: Seller (`msg.sender`) creates multiple processes and pays coordination capital + fee per SRP. Uses CEI ordering: create storage entries first, then collect funds per-SRP.

batchGrantRootSellerConsent(address[],bo.details: Third-party sellers call this to approve or revoke many root sellers in a single transaction. Mirrors `grantRootSellerConsent` behavior.

batchLock(uint256[]).details: Buyer action. For each provided `processId` the root SRP MUST already be `Locked`. The call will collect and lock every SRP in `State.Created` within each process except the root SRP (index 0). All checks are performed first and the pull of the aggregated coordination capital + fee is done once for gas efficiency. Accepts an array of `processIds` and will lock all qualifying SRPs in those processes.

batchLockRoots(uint256[]).details: Buyer of each root SRP calls this with `processIds`. Allows mixed tokens by aggregating per-token totals then performing per-token pulls.

batchRefund(uint256[]).details: Sellers call this to withdraw coordination capital for many SRPs. Performs a two-pass approach: validate and aggregate per-token totals, apply CEI state changes, then perform aggregated token transfers, and finally emit per-SRP `SrpStateChanged` events.

batchRelease(uint256[],uint256).details: Buyer (root buyer of each process) calls this to release all SRPs in each process. Aggregates buyer refunds and collection of cleanup deposits into a single interaction for gas efficiency while preserving per-process archival bookkeeping.

cancel(uint256).details: Only callable by the SRP seller when SRP is in Created state.

grantRootSellerConsent(address,bool).details: Third party sellers explicitly approve the rootSeller before the rootSeller may add SRPs that debit the third party seller's tokens.

params.approved: True to approve, false to revoke
params.rootSeller: The rootSeller address to approve or revoke

refund(uint256).details: Only callable by the SRP seller when SRP is in Released state.

releaseProcessWithCleanupDeposit(uint256.details: Buyer pays `perSrpDeposit * srpCount` to this contract; each SRP is tagged with an archivable timestamp. This is a minimal port of the UnifiedSRP flow for cleanup deposits.

sellerBatchAdd(uint256,address[],uint256.details: Root seller calls to add multiple SRPs in one atomic transaction.

addSrpSigned((uint256,address,uint256,ad.notice: Add a single SRP authorized by an off-chain seller signature

addSrpSignedBatch((uint256,address,uint2.notice: Add multiple signed SRPs in a single atomic transaction

addSrpToProcess(uint256,address,uint256).notice: Add a new SRP to an existing process (root-seller only)

archiveProcessSrpsWithDeposit(uint256).notice: Archive completed process SRPs that have buyer-funded deposits and pay caller

batchArchiveProcesses(uint256[]).notice: Archive multiple processes' SRPs and pay caller from cleanup deposits

batchCancel(uint256[]).notice: Cancel multiple SRPs in a single transaction and return coordination capital to sellers

batchCreateProcesses(address[],uint256[].notice: Create multiple processes each with a root SRP in a single transaction

batchGrantRootSellerConsent(address[],bo.notice: Batch grant or revoke consent for multiple root sellers

batchLock(uint256[]).notice: Lock all CREATED (non-root) SRPs across multiple processes in a single transaction

batchLockRoots(uint256[]).notice: Lock root SRPs for multiple processes in a single transaction

batchRefund(uint256[]).notice: Refund multiple SRPs to their seller in a single transaction

batchRelease(uint256[],uint256).notice: Release multiple processes in a single transaction and place per-SRP cleanup deposits

cancel(uint256).notice: Cancel SRP - seller withdraws deposit before buyer locks (abort trade)

createProcess(address,uint256,address).notice: Create a new process with a root SRP and collect seller coordination capital + fee

grantRootSellerConsent(address,bool).notice: Third party seller approves or revokes an rootSeller to add SRPs on their behalf.

lock(uint256).notice: Lock the root SRP: buyer deposits coordination capital + fee

refund(uint256).notice: Refund SRP - seller withdraws coordination capital + payment after buyer release

releaseProcessWithCleanupDeposit(uint256.notice: Release a process and place buyer-funded per-SRP cleanup deposits

sellerBatchAdd(uint256,address[],uint256.notice: Seller-side batch SRP addition: create SRPs and collect coordination capital
